author: Mrs.T Ladd
comment: Store map gone and store location feature more difficult to find but I found it!  1. Menu icon in upper left 2. My account  3. My Lowe's list 4. App quick list  ~Finally~ Ta Da!! The list with the aisle and bay number. Not always accurate but it's a place to start.  However still NO STORE MAP!  Lowe's is not the kind of place I go for a leisurely stroll.  I'm usually grabbing what I need quickly. I need app features to be convenient.  Much less helpful with out the map. Nice that the My Lowe's code is easy to access but not really sure what it does since I've been told by employees that I still need a receipt for returns and I'm not earning points or anything when I use it. So is it just a list of my purchases?

author: Ben Albrecht
comment: Search is pretty bad (compared to home depot app for example).   While comparing to home depot app, store maps would be a great feature to add.   I've also encountered an annoying bug. Tried to order online via the app and the checkout button does not actually check out. No errors given. Just says "verifying address" then returns to the payment input page.

author: Fran Zarnawski
comment: This app is ok to check on stuff, but buying things from it is useless. I've tried twice and both times and my order was nowhere to be found. So much for free next day delivery because of the app, it will be here in three days. Go to stores and shop around its less hassle!!!

author: Blake Kemmis
comment: App search is great. Love that I can find things easily. But I can't stand the login/password system. I entered my password and it said it was wrong. After multiple attempts I reset my password and entered my same password, but it said I already used it... I knew that was my password but it wouldn't let me continue to use it!

author: Jods K
comment: I used to love this App, but all of a sudden it does not show product location anymore ie: aisle or bay product is in, and the map is also missing now. Store is to big for me to wander around looking for things. Disappointed

Still *Unable to save to quick list *When viewing some products, the suggested products are cutoff at the bottom when scrolling down.  *My quick list should NEVER be deleted if I uninstall the app for troubleshooting. My online profile should remain untouched and be able to access quick list items online as well.

reply.author: Lowe's Companies Inc.
reply.content: Thank you for using the Lowe’s app and helping to make our product better!  Another version of the app was published today for download to resolve excessive notifications for the same price reductions.

author: Randy Tang
comment: Downloaded a 26mb app just to try to figure out where item is in store. Item was in location aisle 0 with a blank bay. There is no aisle 0. Website says same thing. I checked home depot's website and they gave exact location so I just went there.

author: Ted Wiatrek
comment: This app had nowhere you can pay your bill. This is useless to me. It's great you can shop, but can't  pay on your card...useless.
Was great, now it's useless. It use to show product location and now only shows aisle and bay. My store map is gone.

author: Tony Kl
comment: Forgets my purchase history. Main reason I have the app and it fails. Maybe it'll help me find something in a store someday but why bother when HD sends email receipt just by using a credit card.

author: Wesley Slocum
comment: You need to update a bug, it keeps notifying me every 10-15 minutes that prices have dropped on my list, even after I have checked it, and exited out of the app. SUPER ANNOYING, bout to down rate it and delete if this isn't fixed asap!

author: Jack Wiggins
comment: Slow, cluttered, and full of annoying, scrolling ads for all sorts of stuff I have no interest in. The first and main function, SEARCH, is shrunk & buried along the top edge and difficult to hit. This and the version before it have done more to KEEP me from using it than anything.

author: Derin Zerr
comment: The app still doesn't show where items are in the store like the old version used to. Hate to say it, but the Home Depot app DOES do that which makes shopping so much easier. Please add that feature back in.

reply.author: Lowe's Companies Inc.
reply.content: Thanks for using the Lowe's app and commenting to help make our app better!  You should only see each sequence of tutorials one time unless you uninstall and reinstall the app.  Are you seeing differently?

comment: Lists items as in stock that aren't.  List locations within stores that literally don't exist. No one in store ever heard of such a location. Total waste of time.Useless.

author: trance.dance .711
comment: Spent lots of time and research filling the cart with items for them to only disappear, and more than once. Very frustrating.

author: W K
comment: No home button. You're stuck pressing the back button until you get to the start or force close the app

author: Dustin Burkhardt
comment: I cannot get signed into the app to use my card. Please help!! 😠

author: john Spooner
comment: You guys really need to look at home depots app and model off that yours isn't up to par they have way more daily deals a little easier to find sales and your weekly add isn't available all the time

author: Mark Warren
comment: Garbage, poor response and frequent freeze ups.

author: BadFrad AZZ
comment: You have to put items in your cart to get prices, now 15 items items in cart, want to buy one, opps! It takes an hour to remove the other items!

author: William McNett
comment: What did you do to the in store map? Not that anything is where you say it is. But at least it's a start.

author: Miguel Vela
comment: Is asking for 15-16digit number to logged in but card only has11 numbers

author: Tom Hoer
comment: 3 or 4 Notifications a day in notification bar and no way to disable. I don't need the aggregation.

author: Mirna Hernandez
comment: Would have rated a 5, but map feature is not available anymore.

author: Arthur Bides
comment: No store maps now or weekly ads.

author: stone seal
comment: The cart does not load.  Sucks!

author: Jason H
comment: Any log in, what's the point of this app?

author: Ryan Rice
comment: The quick list feature is not working and hasn't for several days

author: James Cuesta
comment: Thanks

author: Earl Hartsell
comment: This app is kind of hard to use. Changing your store or pick another one specific item is very difficult. My theory is it would be better if Lowe's itself had a better inventory control system. I was told at one store you cannot believe something is in stock after it reaches 3. I have literally ordered things with them showing available and more than 3 only to be called and told they don't have them at all. It is very frustrating.

I love Lowes and spend quite a bit of money there renovating homes.  However, why isn't there a filter option for "made in USA" on the app?   I'm not buying things made in China for a lot of reasons, yet I have to go to the store to physically look at the boxes to identify which items create jobs here in the USA & which have been offshored. Please fix the app. I'm trying to buy from your store, & yet you aren't making it easy.

author: Billy Mac
comment: Not very useful. After walking around for a while in a Lowe's store trying to find something, I decided to download this app to see if it could tell me. Unfortunately it doesn't do that. So I had to wait a while more until I could find an employee that wasn't too busy to help. He even said it was stupid that feature wasn't on there or the website. I appreciated him looking it up and even went with me to find it.

author: David Cantwell
comment: The app is way to slow to load any of the account information and lately hasn't been able to load it at all. Making the use of the app in store nearly useless. Best part of the app is locating products in store (isle & bin).

author: Thomas Vanon
comment: Fairly nice app, but flawed. Wish lists & other List features are extensive (with problems, see below). Aisle numbers for all in-stock items is great (more problems, see below). Sometimes accurate info & inventory (mostly, for my local store). Problems: Quick List: Not shared between devices, separate from all other lists. Moving & sorting to other lists a pain. Cart: Slow to load & inferior to lists. (Don't use cart until ready to purchase, use lists.) Notifications: Constant alerts for price changes of items in Quick List, with no setting to turn off! (Unforgivable. Block entire app from notifications in Android settings! Thanks, Google.)

author: Mark Randol
comment: Runs in background at startup and always wants to know where you are.  Kept getting permission request pop ups without running the app, even after a reboot.  Without the snooping, a nice app.

author: D. Geo
comment: A Big shame because this app is so worthless to everyone that reviews are affecting all the great employees working at various Lowe's throughout the country.  Get your head out of your ass and straighten up this pos app! Your driving all your loyal customers to home depot.
Filter feature doesn't work properly, neither does sort. It's got a nice looking UI, but that's about it. Too inaccurate.

author: Screwball Volleyball
comment: This is one of my favorite apps. It has worked reliably and does everything I would want it to. It's great for looking up specific items I want and finding where they are at whatever store I'm shopping at. I can also access my lists of products that I added from both my phone as well as my computer at home and see how many are in stock. The app makes shopping so much more efficient and enjoyable at Lowes. And it even displays the barcode for my Lowe's account so that at checkout it can be scanned and my purchases can be saved to my Lowe's account.

author: Chad Trotter
comment: ok. finally got rid of the Map!!! Now if we can work on the accuracy of item location. Like actually having the correct isle and bay listed. It's usually 1 isle off. Still gets you in the area if what you are searching for. More room for saved items would be great. Why such a short list? Are you aware how many items are in these stores???

author: Thomas Kunik
comment: This App does seem to have a list of items that are supposed to be in the store.  However. For the last two months anything I have looked for has NOT been where the App says it is supposed to be. I looked for a switch (12V lighted) that I had checked about resupply. Supposed to be in Isle X Bin YY.  Nope? I found it TWO weeks later in a completely different location.  App still said it was still in the other location.  Paid triple to fix and finish my project. Today I looked for an Automatic Center Punch (Isle xx Bay y) 5 in stock. Not even a spot for it there. None to be found. No one working can locate it on the shelf. Because all the "Experts" have been released, demoted and fired no one know anything any more. It was nice to go and ask a question and get a real answer. Not a guess at how it might work.  Nice work goofing up the App (inventory data?) and the workers Lowe's. Uninstalled.  Its useless....
